reviewText:
Basic Information
Title: State of Anarchy
Genre: Action, Casual, Indie, Simulation
Developer: Andrew Junior
Publisher: New Reality Games
Release Date: 27 April, 2016

General Impression
State of Anarchy, also known as Crisis, is a pretty good combination of the action and indie genres. The graphics are simple, two-dimensional, but they have something… they look attractive, creative and very charming. The atmosphere is about basically going through 40 different maps, where you must reach the bank and kill the bosses. Throughout the maps you will find everything that a normal city has, alike: buildings, streets, cars, nature objects, etc. The audio is pretty much basically the pain sounds of the enemies, as well as yourself, the car sounds, and mostly the weapon shots. The music is pretty nice, the game contains a long soundtrack, which is being played through the maps, and at the begging of every mission there is playing a victory soundtrack. The gameplay is literally shooting as many enemies as you want, driving cars, and basically doing destruction. The engines and the mechanics are alright, the enemies move well, they tend to come from many sides to you, but what I dislike is that the cars get stuck from time to time, even in passable places. Overall, it’s a pretty nice action-indie, as well as a level-based game.

Strong Points
Simple but well-designed 2D graphics
Pretty nice soundtrack and SFX
Relatively challenging gameplay
High amount of enemies and cars
Weapons will constantly change
Pretty nice level-based gameplay
Many bosses and talent point
40 open-world levels to explore (20 normal ones, 20 hardcore ones)
The ability to load levels in normal mode
Weak Points
A bit too repetitive sometimes
Not enough enemy types
Your car gets stuck from time to time, even in passable places
General Ratings
Graphics: 8/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Audio/Music: 8.5/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Story: N/A
Engines/Mechanics: 8/10

Personal Rating: 7.8/10

reviewText:
This game is very fun to play, bullethell action packed runner crimsonland style, but here you will mostly run forward instead of backwards running, because enemies never stops spawning, and the longer you stay the more and more enemies will spawn, so if you stuck in the corner surrounded by lots of cars and suicide bombers kiss your a55 goodbye :).

+You can level up your talents like run speed or rate of fire
+Very fun and nice sound work
+Very nice OST
+Bullet hell
+It gets pretty challenging even at normal difficulty aftrer like level 10.
+You can start from the previous level if you die, so no need to start all over again, also you can start the game from the any level you unlocked so far.
+Super cheap
+Steam cards
+Loads of fun
-NO steam achievements :(((
-Car sometimes stuck at  places that seems passable so you die trying to get out fo that hell :)

reviewText: The idea of this game was born in the city of Minsk during 'Global Game Jam 2015'. After many days of intense work and sleepless night 'State of Anarchy' finally made it on Steam. This is a dream come true! I would like to thank our publisher 'New Reality Games' and Steam community for making this possible. You are the best! reviewText:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=695657854

State of Anarchy is a great combination of not taking yourself too seriously, yet making something that feels polished. A solid 7.5/10.

The simplicity of the shooting mechanics with the ever increasing level of difficulty gives you a challenge where you never quite feel in control. Just when you think you have an advantage via a new, more powerful weapon, or strategically distributing your Talent Points"
date: the game throws swarm after swarm of gun-toting baddies. With the occasional missile launching hummer. And thats just on normal difficulty.\n\nI am willing to over-look the repetitive nature of this game and wonky driving mechanics because every other aspect of this game is near perfect for me. The visuals are entertaining
recommended: the audio is very fitting and whimsical
hoursPlayed: and game play is blissfully utter chaos. I highly recommend this game if you are remotely considering it."

reviewText:
A small, fun game that doesn't take itself too seriously. Very fast-paced gameplay behaving like a top down bullet hell shooter. Your goal is simple. Make your way between banks in a city and fight a boss inside each one. Each boss uses a different weapon, and after each bank you clear, the number of enemies on the streets and their difficulty increases. There are several weapons you get to use, drive cars, and even level up and improve some of your stats.

The art style is simplistic, but very charming. It looks like scribbled drawings of a small kid, which is a nice and unique style I've not seen before. To complement that, one of my favourite things about the game is how all the sound effects in it seem to be done with voices. The music is pretty nice and light-hearted too.

The game can get a tad repetitive, so it's mostly fun in short bursts, but considering the mechanics and the aesthetics are executed nicely and the game is very cheap, I can definitely recommend it.

reviewText:
1. Well you can already see the graphic, so you can decide for yourself if you like it or not.

2. For the sounds it's all made with the mouth which could get annoying really soon. If you mute the game and tap out for a moment (since there is no window-mode our other options) and then tap in again, the sound will be back on. The you first have turn the sound back on and mute it again and hope you weren't shot in the meantime.

3. Now I read that the game was called “Crisis” once. But now it's called “state of anarchy”. So it should have the same name everywhere and not be called “crisis” in the taskbar and the sound options and suddenly “state of anarchy” again in the task manager.

4. It get's repetitive really soon, since it's always. Run to a bank, kill the boss (who sometimes gets easier than the last) and run to the next bank. With only a few different enemy types.

5. At the start of the game you can either run or select a game mode. There it's a little confusing when you reed that you can start at level 8 and when you select it, you can only choose between the first 5 levels. Although that's apparently your character level. So I guess I just didn't understand that at first. But if you start at level 1 again you keep your character level. And while you loose your weapon, you keep your abilities. So a real new start isn't possible.

6. The last point is not about the game but: Did the developer seriously evaluate his own game?

reviewText: State of Anarchy is a simple top-down shooter, where you have only one true goal, kill and kill all enemies what you see.\n\nIn this game you will find two game mode: a normal and a hardcore mode. The difference between this two a game saving, in a hardcore mode you will not find a save, so if you die in this mode, you should start all from first level. In a normal mode if you die, you should start only from the current level. Gameplay is that: you should following a arrow to the target zone and on you way killing a enemies and picking up money or health pack what they dropped. You pass a current level when you kill a boss" and pick up a some upgrade what he drop
date: for example more damage for weapon. Also when you move beside objects you can use a car for this.\n\nThe graphic looks very simple
recommended: this is hand drawn styled and looks like a little boys draw. Sound are simple

reviewText:
State of Anarchy is a 'top down' 'twin stick shooter' game, I use the inverted commas because the game doesn't take itself too seriously, as it should be in this case.


The 'graphics' are really funny, bordering on cute and reminiscent of hand drawn cartoons of a very young (and destructive) child.

The gameplay itself is simple and engaging, addicting, fun and relaxing at the same time. I use relaxing in a different sense, relaxing as in, easy to get a hold of and there is a sense of accomplishment killing wave after wave of faceless grey citizens.


You go from bank to bank and each successive bank has a boss, and if you defeat the boss you get a new weapon.


The music and 'sounds' and sound effects are rather goofy and fit into the game perfectly.

You get to drive around a car and crush people beneath the tires, oh and you can fire your weapon too, whilst driving.

You get talent points, using which you can gain certain abilities and improve on them - character development.

What more can one ask for? I don't have to think twice before recommending this game, if you're looking for something fun, simplistic and funny.


Rating this game on a scale would be rather difficult as to what criteria would one use and in what sense would each point imply on a definite scale? Still, I will give it a shot


A strong 8 out of 10.
